intro: Miscolobium villosum, commonly known as the hairy miscolobium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or brown, and they bloom in the spring. Miscolobium villosum is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
